description:
Description
===========
when try to get vlanid and vswitch for portgroup, the driver use the attribute "portgroup.vswitch" which is full name of the vswitch ("key-xxxxx-")
programe should user "portgroup.spec.vswitchname" instead
title: Should Use 'p_gp.spec.vswitchname' instead of 'p_gp.vswitch.split' in vmware driver

comments.content:
Description
===========
when try to get vlanid and vswitch for portgroup, the driver use the attribute "portgroup.vswitch" which is full name of the vswitch ("key-xxxxx-")
programe should user "portgroup.spec.vswitchname" instead
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~fang-he

comments.content:
Hi Fang,
Thank you for reporting this case.

are you talking about this line ? https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/vmwareapi/network_util.py#L170

and about this data structure https://www.vmware.com/support/developer/vc-sdk/visdk41pubs/ApiReference/vim.host.PortGroup.Specification.html ?

As I can see get_add_vswitch_port_group_spec uses "DVPortgroupConfigSpec" https://github.com/openstack/networking-vsphere/blob/master/networking_vsphere/utils/network_util.py#L98

and in this spec, there is no field "vswitchname" https://www.vmware.com/support/developer/vc-sdk/visdk400pubs/ReferenceGuide/vim.dvs.DistributedVirtualPortgroup.ConfigSpec.html

Can you please add logs if you have some logs related to this case ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~anton-haldin

comments.content:
Yes. 
In the for statement, the port_grps_on_host is getted by "config.network.portgroup" via a "HostSystem" moi. https://www.vmware.com/support/developer/vc-sdk/visdk41pubs/ApiReference/vim.HostSystem.html

so the p_gp is an instance of "HostPortGroup", and p_gp.spec should be "HostPortGroupSpec" http://pubs.vmware.com/vsphere-55/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.vmware.wssdk.apiref.doc%2Fvim.host.PortGroup.Specification.html

the "DVPortgroupConfigSpec" is used to create only.
